IngestionKey.Title: Ingestion Key
IngestionKey.Description: Used to associate event requests from Web Pixel. This token helps us:
IngestionKey.Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Filter misconfigured or invalid requests (noise reduction)
‚Ä¢ Correctly associate pixel events with orders (diagnostics)
‚Ä¢ Identify request sources in multi-store scenarios
IngestionKey.SecurityNote: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Security Note: This token is visible in browser network requests and is NOT a strong security boundary. Real security is provided by multiple layers:
IngestionKey.SecurityLayers: ‚Ä¢ TLS Encryption: All data transmission is encrypted via HTTPS ‚Ä¢ Origin Verification: Only accepts requests from Shopify checkout pages (with Referer/ShopDomain fallback) ‚Ä¢ Integrity Verification Key (HMAC): Used for integrity verification and basic abuse prevention ‚Ä¢ Rate Limiting: Prevents abuse and abnormal traffic ‚Ä¢ Data Minimization: We do not collect, process, or send end-customer PII
IngestionKey.BoundaryNote: Security Boundary Note: This token is mainly used for event association and diagnostics. Do not treat this token as a strong security credential.
IngestionKey.ReinstallPrompt: Please reinstall the app or click generate token
IngestionKey.LaxDesc: Non-whitelisted/HMAC failure may still be accepted
IngestionKey.LaxWarning: Requests from non-whitelisted sources or HMAC verification failures that are not rejected may still be accepted and marked as low signature integrity.
IngestionKey.GraceWindow: Old token still valid: Previous token will expire on {{date}}. Until then, both new and old tokens can be used for smooth transition.
IngestionKey.GraceWindowEnd: After the transition period, the old token will automatically expire.
IngestionKey.OldTokenExpired: Old token expired: Previous token has been automatically cleaned up.
IngestionKey.NoTokenError: ‚ö†Ô∏è Association token not configured: Please generate a token immediately.
IngestionKey.NoTokenDesc: When the token is not configured, pixel events can still be received, but integrity signals will decrease.
IngestionKey.P0SecurityDetails: Production environment must explicitly set: ‚Ä¢ PIXEL_ALLOW_NULL_ORIGIN_WITH_SIGNATURE_ONLY env var ‚Ä¢ If set to false, Origin: null requests will be rejected.
IngestionKey.IngestionKeyRisk: ingestionKey Visibility Risk: ‚Ä¢ ingestion_key is distributed to pixel client and is a public signal ‚Ä¢ Real order authenticity should rely on Shopify webhook/order reconciliation
IngestionKey.MustDoActions: Mandatory Actions: ‚Ä¢ Regularly rotate ingestionKey (Recommended every 90 days) ‚Ä¢ Monitor abnormal event reception patterns ‚Ä¢ If abuse suspected, change token immediately
IngestionKey.RotationMechNote: Token Rotation Mechanism Description: When changing token, system automatically saves old token as previousIngestionSecret for 30 minutes grace period.
IngestionKey.HowItWorksDesc: The server records this token and uses it as an integrity signal. Replacing the token initiates a 30-minute grace window for the old token.
IngestionKey.TokenRotationMech: Token Rotation Mechanism: ‚Ä¢ Old token saved as previousIngestionSecret ‚Ä¢ Old token usable for 30 mins ‚Ä¢ System automatically syncs new token to Web Pixel config

Source: Shopify OAuth. Purpose: Authentication and session maintenance. Retention: Expires with the session or follows Shopify session policy. Tracking.P1: In the current version, {{appName}} only uses event receipts (PixelEventReceipt) reported by Shopify Web Pixels and minimized local logs to help you diagnose if pixels are working correctly, identify potential order loss risks, and display statistics and reports within the app. We do NOT read order details from Shopify, nor do we access Protected Customer Data (PCD).
Tracking.P2: We request read_customer_events permission solely to support Web Pixel event reception and processing. This permission is used to receive standard pixel events (like checkout_completed) and is not equivalent to read_customers. We do NOT read Customer Profiles or sensitive PII (like names, addresses).
Tracking.P3: Web Pixel Behavior: Our Web Pixel code does not read customer personal information from the checkout DOM; it relies only on the standard event payload provided by Shopify. We do not attempt to reconstruct customer identity (e.g., email/phone) via Web Pixel.

ServerSideWarning.Title: Important: Server-Side Delivery is Not Available in this Version
ServerSideWarning.Content: Server-side delivery to ad platforms is disabled by default. The core function is client-side pixel and verification reconciliation. The current version only receives and verifies Web Pixel events for in-app diagnosis and verification, and does not send server-side events to third-party platforms.

Usage.Reconciliation: We help you discover tracking gaps and optimize configuration by comparing pixel event receipts with internal logs. When events are not sent to any platform due to lack of user consent, we may still save minimal metadata (e.g., event key, event type, timestamp) for deduplication and diagnosis purposes, but we will NOT save sensitive content like product details or amounts. The current version does NOT read order data from the Shopify Admin API for reconciliation.
Usage.Compliance: Based on the customer's consent status (Shopify customerPrivacy), we automatically determine whether to send events to specific platforms, ensuring compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR/CCPA.
Usage.PCD: The current publicly listed version does not access Shopify Protected Customer Data (PCD). We do not request order/customer data scopes, do not subscribe to order webhooks, and do not read order or customer details via the Admin API. We rely solely on Web Pixel event receipts for diagnosis and verification. If we introduce features like order-based verification/reconciliation or repurchase analysis in the future, we will enable them after obtaining Shopify PCD approval and updating this privacy policy and in-app instructions.

Alerts.Telegram: Telegram Bot API: Used only when Telegram alerts are enabled, sending shop-level alert summaries and metrics. Contains no order details or end-customer information.

checkoutExtWarning.title: Important: Checkout Extensibility Migration Edge Cases
checkoutExtWarning.intro: When migrating from checkout.liquid to Checkout Extensibility, please note:
items: Some Additional Scripts may depend on checkout.liquid features (such as Liquid variables, DOM manipulation, etc.) that are not available in Web Pixel sandbox.
Web Pixel runs in a strict sandbox (Web Worker) that cannot access DOM, localStorage, third-party cookies, etc.
Scripts containing DOM manipulation (e.g. adding custom UI elements, modifying page content) need to be migrated to Checkout UI Extensions.
Scripts that only send conversion events (GA4, Meta Pixel, TikTok Pixel, etc.) can be migrated to Web Pixel.
checkoutExtWarning.recommendation: Recommendation: First confirm the functionality of each script, then choose the appropriate migration method (Web Pixel or UI Extension).

checkoutBehaviorHint.title: Possible Reasons for Missing checkout_completed Event
checkoutBehaviorHint.subtitle: In many cases, not receiving checkout_completed is not a bug, but expected behavior.
checkoutBehaviorHint.upsellDesc: If a post-purchase upsell app is installed, the normal checkout flow may be interrupted; the user might not reach the standard Thank You page.
checkoutBehaviorHint.consentDesc: If the customer rejects analytics/marketing cookie consent, Shopify may suppress Web Pixel firing. This is a platform limitation that cannot be bypassed.
checkoutBehaviorHint.shopPayDesc: Shop Pay accelerated checkout may skip the standard order status page, resulting in no pixel event being fired.
checkoutBehaviorHint.ajaxCheckoutDesc: Some custom or headless checkout implementations may not trigger standard Web Pixel events.
checkoutBehaviorHint.note: If the missing event rate is within 5%, it is usually within a normal and reasonable range.
